Desc: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has termed the agriculture sector as the first engine of growth and announced schemes such as the Prime Minister Dhan-Dhaanya Krishi Yojana - Developing Agri Districts Programme – a scheme that is likely to benefit 1.7 crore farmers in 100 districts with low crop production-- for the sector in the budget presented in Parliament on Saturday. Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said the budget will help in all-round development of the farm sector. The farmers’ organisations, however, are unhappy with the announcements and said the budget will lead to further rise in the input costs involved in farming.
